intro: Hymenatherum belenidium, commonly known as the Belenidium hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, butterfly-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments within its native range.
